Description: Stamp (vessel): mikyala. Measure of black cumin. Seven line Kufic inscription, with a six pointed star. Fragment of rim attached. Fragment of rim attached. Made of olive-green glass.
Curator's comments: From the same die: Miles, G.C. 1963. ‘Contributions to Arabic metrology’ II (II. Peter Ruthven collection). New York, 14.

The only other published stamp of al-Qāsim for 'black cumin' is one dated 122 with Ẓaffār b. Shabba (Launois 1957, 77). For the identification of the herb reference should be made to the discussion of cumin by Miles (1951, 16). Bibliography: Launois, Aimée. 1957. Estampilles et poids faibles en verre Omeyyades et Abbasides au Musée Arabe du Caire, ‘Mélanges islamologiques’ III; Miles, G.C. 1951. ‘Early Arabic Weights and Stamps: a supplement’. New York.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (107)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Muslim b. al-'Arrāf
